  def update_awesomeness(arr, i, x, curr_aws):
      n = len(arr)
      old = arr[i]
      # Remove the old breaks that involve the old value at i
      if i > 0:
          if arr[i-1] != old:
              curr_aws -= i * (n - i)   # break at (i-1, i): break index = i-1 -> contribution = i * (n - i) [because starting points: 0..i-1 -> i, ending points: i..n-1 -> n-i]
      if i < n-1:
          if old != arr[i+1]:
              curr_aws -= (i+1) * (n-1-i)   # break at (i, i+1): break index = i -> (i+1) * (n-1-i)

      arr[i] = x   # update the array

      if i > 0:
          if arr[i-1] != x:
              curr_aws += i * (n - i)
      if i < n-1:
          if x != arr[i+1]:
              curr_aws += (i+1) * (n-1-i)

      return curr_aws

  The break index is i-1. The number of starting points: from 0 to i-1 -> i choices.

For the right break: the break between i and i+1: 
  The break index is i. The number of starting points: from 0 to i -> i+1 choices.
  The number of ending points: from i+1 to n-1 -> n-1-i choices.
  So the contribution is (i+1)*(n-1-i).
